post_text: A message from Superintendent Grande: Hope your summer is going well. As you are most likely aware, Governor Murphy and the Department of Education, on June 26, released guidelines regarding the physical reopening of schools in September. We, as a school district, in conjunction with input from such groups as our Parent Teacher Associations (PTAs) and Faculty Councils, are in the process of developing a plan and policies for this reopening. This process will continue over the next few weeks with the goal of communicating the plan to our various stakeholders during the first week of August. In the meantime, please email reopening@clarkschools.org with any input that you might want to share regarding our reopening.

A message from Superintendent Grande: Hope the week was a productive one for everyone. As was communicated in early March prior to the school closure, Friday, May 22; Tuesday, June 2; and Friday, June 12 were going to be our three snow giveback days. However, allowing for an extended Memorial Day Weekend, no school on Primary
Election Day, and a long weekend in June does not seem to make as much sense now given the current situation. Ending the school year and remote learning early instead makes more good sense. As a result, these three giveback days will now be Friday, June 19 through Tuesday, June 23.
The last day for students and staff will be Thursday, June 18. Accordingly, our early dismissal days will begin on Tuesday, June 16. Many thanks for your flexibility and understanding, and best wishes for a great weekend.
